channel.title: U.S. News - Opinion
channel.description: Commentary and analysis on the pressing issues of the day.

item.title: Trump Shouldn't Blame Gun Violence on Violent Video Games
item.dc:creator: David Zendle
item.description: Research demonstrates no link can confidently be made between violent video games and gun violence.

item.title: Medicaid Work Requirements Only Deny People Health Care
item.dc:creator: Rachel Graves
item.description: Don't believe that Medicaid work requirements do anything but deny people health care.

item.title: New North Korea Talks Bring Skepticism and Hope
item.dc:creator: Michael H. Fuchs
item.description: There are reasons to be both hopeful and skeptical about new talks with North Korea.

item.title: Daily Cartoons: March 8, 2018
There Will Be No Democratic Wave in Texas
item.dc:creator: Peter Roff
item.description: Don't believe that a big, blue wave is coming ashore in Texas' elections this year.

item.title: Listen to Teachers to Avoid Graduation Scandals Like D.C. Public Schools'
item.dc:creator: Nat Malkus
item.description: Teachers can avert graduation scandals, if leaders will listen.

item.title: What Donald Trump Doesn't Get About Trade and Tariffs
item.dc:creator: James Warren
item.description: The tariffs discussion is important but distracts from confronting other pressing economic issues.

item.title: How the DCCC Screwed Up the Texas Primary
item.dc:creator: Pat Garofalo
item.description: Texas shows why national committees need to stay out of primaries.

item.title: Donald Trump Is Exploiting Resentment to Break Down Our Social Cohesion
item.dc:creator: Eric Schnurer
item.description: Donald Trump is the apotheosis of our self-obsessed, morally bankrupt politics.

item.title: We Need a Comprehensive Approach to the Renewable Fuel Standard
item.dc:creator: Ryan Alexander
item.description: The current standard is unworkable and needs broad reform.

item.title: Betsy DeVos Education Dept to Roll Back Help for Students With Disabilities
item.dc:creator: Scott Sargrad
item.description: The education secretary appears to believe that protecting the rights of children with disabilities is not in her job description.

item.title: Teachers Don't Want to Be Armed With Guns to Stop School Shootings
item.dc:creator: Josh Parker
item.description: The answer is not more guns inside; it's fewer guns outside, coupled with supporting the efforts of teachers and the lives of children.

item.title: Daily Cartoons: March 7, 2018
Kellyanne Conway and the Stream of Trump Administration Ethics Problems
item.dc:creator: Robert Schlesinger
item.description: Kellyanne Conway and the EPA headline the latest ethical questions involving the Trump administration.

item.title: Global Power Is Shifting From the U.S. to China
item.dc:creator: Lawrence J. Haas
item.description: Events in Washington and Beijing show the tectonic plates of global power may be shifting.

item.title: Bad Virtual Charter Schools Need to Go
item.dc:creator: Greg Richmond
item.description: Too many virtual schools aren't serving their students well.

item.title: Imagining President Trump's Internal Dialogue After the Loss of Hope Hicks
item.dc:creator: Jamie Stiehm
item.description: What is Trump mumbling to himself now that Hope Hicks is gone?

item.title: Prevent Violence at the Societal Level
item.dc:creator: Bandy Lee
item.description: Making changes at the national level can prevent enormous suffering and tragedy, at very little cost.

item.title: Donald Trump Proposed Tariffs to Mask the Fact That He's Weak and Inept
item.dc:creator: John Stoehr
item.description: The president is risking an international trade war to protect his strongman image.

item.title: The Sanders-Lee Resolution Can End Saudi Arabia's War in Yemen
item.dc:creator: Robert Naiman
item.description: How a Senate resolution can end Saudi Arabia's war in Yemen.

item.title: Was Sam Nunberg Drunk? Worse: Sam Nunberg Is Trump.
item.dc:creator: Nicole Hemmer
item.description: Trump's former aide typifies the president's habit of hiring mirrored versions of himself.

item.title: Trump's Very Sad Trade Tariffs
item.dc:creator: Desmond Lachman
item.description: The administration is making a painful recession more likely.

item.title: Daily Cartoons: March 6, 2018
Donald Trump Is Wrong About Tariffs
item.dc:creator: Peter Roff
item.description: Protectionism may win some Rust Belt votes, but it means higher prices for everyone.

item.title: Opioid Crisis Is Struggle Between David and Goliath of Trump's White House
item.dc:creator: Lloyd Sederer
item.description: Trump's White House is not only refusing to act on the opioid crisis, they're actively hurting citizens at their most vulnerable.

item.title: Donald Trump and the U.S. Can't Go It Alone on Trade
item.dc:creator: Christine McDaniel
item.description: The U.S. can't go it alone on international trade.

item.title: Why Are Senate Democrats Backing the GOP's Bank Deregulation Bill?
item.dc:creator: Pat Garofalo
item.description: A bunch of Senate Democrats support a bank deregulation bill that is bad politics and awful policy.

item.title: Commentary: In Slovakia Murder of Investigative Journalist Triggers Crisis, Opportunity
item.dc:creator: Dalibor Rohac
item.description: Reporter Jan Kuciak's murder has catalyzed Slovakia, whether for better or worse remains to be seen.

item.title: Cutting UNRWA Funding Could Put Gaza on the Brink and Backfire at Israel
item.dc:creator: Shira Efron
item.description: The Trump administration's decision to withhold funding for Palestinian refugees could only worsen the situation in the Gaza Strip and backfire on Israel.

item.title: Colorado State Rep. Lebsock Ousted for Sexual Harassment of Colleague
item.dc:creator: Laura Chapin
item.description: The #MeToo movement reached the Colorado General Assembly – and cost a legislator his job.

item.title: Don't Sweat Trump's Steel and Aluminum Tariffs
item.dc:creator: Robert Scott
item.description: Protections for steel and aluminum can help fight predatory trade practices, and won't have big costs.

item.title: Daily Cartoons: March 5, 2018
Daily Cartoons: March 4, 2018
New Evidence the Trump Administration Is Meddling in Venezuela's Elections
item.dc:creator: Mark Weisbrot
item.description: The Trump administration is intensifying its regime change efforts to potentially include torpedoing Venezuela's presidential election.

item.title: Daily Cartoons: March 3, 2018

item.dc:creator: Robert Schlesinger
item.description: What prompted Trump's tariff surprise? White House chaos and a presidential tantrum.

item.title: Is Pope Francis Selling Out to Communist China?
item.dc:creator: Lawrence McQuillan
item.description: The Vatican's plan to recognize Chinese-government appointed bishops feels like a betrayal to Catholics.

item.title: Trump's Steel and Aluminum Tariffs Will Achieve Nothing
item.dc:creator: Jackie Varas
item.description: Tariffs on steel and aluminum will achieve nothing and ultimately be struck down.

item.title: How Republicans Win the 2018 Midterms
item.dc:creator: Peter Roff
item.description: Republicans need to take the focus off Trump and put it onto real solutions.

item.title: The Navy Wants More Money Than the Already Massive Pentagon Budget
item.dc:creator: Ryan Alexander
item.description: Somehow the Pentagon's massive budget request just wasn't enough.

item.title: How Can the United Kingdom Remain in the EU After Brexit Vote?
item.dc:creator: James Dobbins
item.description: The United Kingdom may reverse course on its decision to leave the European Union.

item.title: Jerome Powell Should Keep the Fed Focused on Jobs
item.dc:creator: Chad Stone
item.description: New chairman Jerome Powell should keep the central bank aimed at boosting employment.

item.title: We Must Act Now to Avoid the Fate of Cape Town, South Africa's Water Crisis
item.dc:creator: Sindiso Mnisi Weeks
item.description: Cape Town is running out of water – a harbinger of crises to come around the world.

item.title: Citizens Don't Need AR-15s
item.dc:creator: Patrick Mondaca
item.description: High-velocity weapons have no place in the hands of civilians.

item.dc:creator: Ashley Pratte
item.description: Georgia Republicans should know that legislative intimidation isn't conservative.

item.title: Congress Should Address Gun Safety, Not Unelected Wal-Mart and Dick's CEOs

item.title: How Markets Can Solve America's Gun Problem
item.dc:creator: James R. Harrigan

item.title: Global Economic Repercussions If Federal Reserve Raises Interest Rates
item.dc:creator: Desmond Lachman
item.description: Real economic strains in Brazil and Mexico are on the horizon as the Fed proceeds with monetary policy normalization.

item.title: Jared Kushner and Ivanka Trump Need to Get Out of the Administration
item.dc:creator: Pat Garofalo
item.description: Recent news proves Jared Kushner and Ivanka Trump can't keep working in the White House.

item.title: Country Needs Return to Civic Debate to Solve Gun Control, Political Divide
item.dc:creator: Katie Packer Beeson

item.title: Donald Trump Should Reject Import Taxes on Steel and Aluminum
item.dc:creator: Bryan Riley
item.description: President Trump should reject new rules on steel and aluminum imports.

item.title: Are Colleges Moving Too Fast or Too Slow With Readiness Programs?
item.dc:creator: Lindsay Daugherty
item.description: Are states moving too fast or too slow to address the college readiness problem?

item.title: Daily Cartoons: March 1, 2018
The Republican Party Is Doing Well But State Elections Are Concern for 2018
item.dc:creator: Peter Roff
item.description: Everything's coming up roses for the GOP – but that doesn't mean they're safe in the 2018 midterms.

item.title: Bernie Sanders Is Right: Get the U.S. Out of Saudi Arabia's War in Yemen
item.dc:creator: Pat Garofalo
item.description: Bernie Sanders and his colleagues are right to call out America's role in Yemen's nightmare.

item.title: Energy Interests Dominate Interior Department's Royalty Policy Committee
item.dc:creator: Ryan Alexander

item.title: California Is Turning Its Back on Feinstein in Favor of Young Rising Stars
item.dc:creator: Jamie Stiehm

item.title: Don't Forget Billy Graham's Anti-Semitic Turn With Richard Nixon

item.title: Money Doesn't Guarantee Infrastructure Success

item.title: Is the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act Better for Corporations or American Workers?

item.description: Make the world a safer place for vulnerable elders with dementia and the ones that care for them.
